name: Dosa - Lentil and rice savory Crepes. Vegan Glutenfree
description: Dosas are the flat bread equivalent side with South Indian meals and also a great snack with different types of crepes, with fillings, styles and so on.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup medium or long grain rice (I use basmati)
2 Tablespoons toor daal (Pigeon pea or chana daal(bengal gram) - optional)
1/4 cup thick Poha (Rice flakes- for crisp crepes, optional)

itemListElement.text: Rinse the rice well and soak overnight in a large bowl.
itemListElement.name: Rinse the rice well and soak overnight in a large bowl.

itemListElement.text: Rinse the urad daal(black gram) and other dals if using and soak along with the fenugreek seeds(methi), overnight. Urad dal and fenugreek attract wild yeast for the fermentation.
itemListElement.name: Rinse the urad daal(black gram) and other dals if using and soak along with the fenugreek seeds(methi), overnight. Urad dal and fenugreek attract wild yeast for the fermentation.

itemListElement.text: Drain the soaking liquid of the daal/lentils  and reserve the soaking liquid.
itemListElement.name: Drain the soaking liquid of the daal/lentils  and reserve the soaking liquid.

itemListElement.text: If using Poha(rice flakes), wash and add them to the soaking rice to soak for a few minutes.
itemListElement.name: If using Poha(rice flakes), wash and add them to the soaking rice to soak for a few minutes.

itemListElement.text: Grind the daal and fenugreek seeds in your blender/wet grinder using some of the soaking liquid into a smooth fluffy paste.
itemListElement.name: Grind the daal and fenugreek seeds in your blender/wet grinder using some of the soaking liquid into a smooth fluffy paste.

itemListElement.text: Drain the rice, reserve the soaking liquid. Grind the rice with a little of the soaking water. The rice will make a gritty batter.
itemListElement.name: Drain the rice, reserve the soaking liquid. Grind the rice with a little of the soaking water. The rice will make a gritty batter.

itemListElement.text: If you can, use your hands to to mix the daal and rice batters together in one large bowl. Or use a large spoon. Add salt, and mix in.
itemListElement.name: If you can, use your hands to to mix the daal and rice batters together in one large bowl. Or use a large spoon. Add salt, and mix in.

itemListElement.text: You can use this batter directly to make the crepes(adjust water content if the batter is too thick). The crepes will have a less fermented flavor.
itemListElement.name: You can use this batter directly to make the crepes(adjust water content if the batter is too thick). The crepes will have a less fermented flavor.

itemListElement.text: Let it ferment for another 6-8 hours in a warm place(85-90 deg F), covered with a towel or lightly with a lid. You can leave it in the oven with the light on to help with the warmth.
itemListElement.name: Let it ferment for another 6-8 hours in a warm place(85-90 deg F), covered with a towel or lightly with a lid. You can leave it in the oven with the light on to help with the warmth.

itemListElement.text: The fermented batter should be frothy, and almost double in volume.
itemListElement.name: The fermented batter should be frothy, and almost double in volume.

itemListElement.text: Note: If you do not have urad dal or fenugreek, you can make the batter with any other lentils and add 1/2 tsp active yeast after blending. Let it sit for 3 to 4 hours to ferment and then use.
itemListElement.name: Note: If you do not have urad dal or fenugreek, you can make the batter with any other lentils and add 1/2 tsp active yeast after blending. Let it sit for 3 to 4 hours to ferment and then use.

itemListElement.text: Heat a 10+ inch nonstick skillet on high heat. Once hot, sprinkle a few drops of water on the skillet. The water should sizzle and evaporate within 2 seconds .
itemListElement.name: Heat a 10+ inch nonstick skillet on high heat. Once hot, sprinkle a few drops of water on the skillet. The water should sizzle and evaporate within 2 seconds .

itemListElement.text: Cut a small wedge from an onion or a potato. Stick a fork into the onion. Add a drop of oil to the hot pan, and spread the oil around, using the onion. you can also use a thick paper towel to spread the oil.
itemListElement.name: Cut a small wedge from an onion or a potato. Stick a fork into the onion. Add a drop of oil to the hot pan, and spread the oil around, using the onion. you can also use a thick paper towel to spread the oil.

itemListElement.text: Pour a ladle full ( a 1/4 cup) of batter onto the hot skillet. Swirl the ladle in concentric circles, to spread out the batter.
itemListElement.name: Pour a ladle full ( a 1/4 cup) of batter onto the hot skillet. Swirl the ladle in concentric circles, to spread out the batter.

itemListElement.text: Drizzle a few drops of oil on the edges.
itemListElement.name: Drizzle a few drops of oil on the edges.

itemListElement.text: Cook the crepe over medium-high heat till the bottom side of the dosa becomes lightly brown and starts to come away at the edges.
itemListElement.name: Cook the crepe over medium-high heat till the bottom side of the dosa becomes lightly brown and starts to come away at the edges.

itemListElement.text: You can flip and cook the other side for a few minutes for crispier crepe.
itemListElement.name: You can flip and cook the other side for a few minutes for crispier crepe.

itemListElement.text: Serve hot with coconut chutney, Sambhar(pigeon pea and veggies stew), Potato and onion subzi! or fill them up with anything you like and make it your own fusion filled crepe
itemListElement.name: Serve hot with coconut chutney, Sambhar(pigeon pea and veggies stew), Potato and onion subzi! or fill them up with anything you like and make it your own fusion filled crepe
